title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 575.5 - Participation in the community support services program
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 575.5 - Participation in the community support services program

State Regulations
(a) Participation by a local governmental
unit in the community support services program shall be contingent upon an
affirmative election by the local governmental unit prior to May 1, 1987 or May
1st of any year. Such participation shall take effect in the following local
fiscal year. (b) A local
governmental unit which elects to participate in the community support services
program shall have responsibility for the coordination of the community support
services program within its defined geographical area in accordance with the
local government plan. Such responsibilities shall include: (1)
incorporating the community support
services program into the local government plan pursuant to article 41 of the

Mental Hygiene Law; (2)
providing
community support services and core services to eligible individuals directly
or through contract with a provider of services; (3)
providing community support services and
core services to eligible individuals, who were formerly served through direct
contracts prior to election by the local governmental unit to participate in
the community support services program. Such provision of community support
services shall begin with the local fiscal year following the election to
participate in the community support services program; except as provided in
subdivision (a) of this section; and
(4)
assuring that a provider of services
which has satisfactorily provided community support services pursuant to the
regulations of the commissioner in the last complete local fiscal year
preceding April 1, 1987 shall have the opportunity to continue to provide the
same level of such service for a period of at least two local fiscal years, beginning with the initial year of participation by the local governmental unit
in the community support services program. (c) A local governmental unit which elects to
participate in the community support services program shall assure the
provision of community support services such as: case management services, advocacy services, clinic treatment, day treatment, day training, continuing
treatment, homemaker services, housekeeping services, on-site rehabilitation
services, sheltered workshop and other vocational programs, psychosocial clubs, neighborhood drop-in centers, transportation services, nonresidential crisis
services, outreach services, preadmission screening, screening and prevention, consultation and education and other services approved by the commissioner in
accordance with the local government plan. (d) A local governmental unit may elect to
participate in the community support services program in conjunction with one
or more other local governmental units. (e) A local governmental unit which does not
elect to participate in the community support services program prior to May 1st
of any year for all subsequent years shall be responsible for incorporating the
community support services program into the local government plan. Notes
